alert.note: Alert for Gwinnett (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:40AM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Haynes Creek at Lenora Road near Snellville affecting Gwinnett County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Big Haynes Creek at Lenora Road near Snellville. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands and pastures near the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on Lenora Road. Some outbuildings near the creek upstream and on the left bank from the bridge will be flooded with around one foot of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EST Tuesday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 09/17/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EST.
